setVariants.name: Reverse Holo
setVariants.description: The reverse holo print of the set.

setVariants.name: Unlimited
setVariants.description: The unlimited print of the set.

abilities.name: Safeguard
abilities.text: Prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Banette by your opponent's Pokémon-ex.

attacks.name: Night Murmurs
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is a Basic Pokémon, that Pokémon is now Confused.

cards.name: Blastoise δ

abilities.name: Shield Veil
abilities.text: Each of your Active Pokémon has no Weakness.

cards.text: This Pokémon is both Fighting Metal type.

attacks.name: Enraged Linear Attack
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage for each damage counter on Blastoise to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

abilities.name: Delta Protection
abilities.text: Any damage done to Camerupt by attacks from your opponent's Pokémon that has δ on its card is reduced by 40 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Linear Attack
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Charizard δ

abilities.name: Peal of Thunder
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when you play Charizard from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon, you may look at the top 5 cards of your deck, choose as many Energy cards as you like, and attach them to 1 of your Pokémon. Discard the other cards.

cards.text: This Pokémon is both Lightning Metal type.

attacks.name: Metal Burn
attacks.text: Discard all Metal Energy attached to Charizard.

abilities.name: Sand Veil
abilities.text: Prevent all damage done to your Benched Pokémon by your opponent's attacks.

attacks.name: Dig Under
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage to that Pokémon. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

attacks.name: Double-edge
attacks.text: Dugtrio does 10 damage to itself.

abilities.name: Overzealous
abilities.text: If your opponent has any Pokémon-ex in play, each of Ludicolo's attacks does 30 more damage to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Knock Off
attacks.text: Choose 1 card from your opponent's hand without looking and discard it.

attacks.name: Even Game
attacks.text: Count the number of your opponent's Pokémon. Search your deck for up to that number of Basic Pokémon and put them onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Stadium Play
attacks.text: If you have a Stadium card in play, remove 1 damage counter from each of your Pokémon. If your opponent has a Stadium card in play, this attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Kick Away
attacks.text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon, if any.

attacks.name: Strong Current
attacks.text: If Manectric has a Pokémon Tool card attached to it, this attack does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon-ex. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Mining
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Trainer card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. If that card is a Pokémon Tool card, you may attach it to 1 of your Pokémon instead. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Bite Off
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is Pokémon-ex, this attack does 20 damage plus 30 more damage.

abilities.name: Excavate
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may look at the top card of your deck. Put that card back on top of your deck, or discard that card. This power can't be used if Sableye is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Disable
attacks.text: Choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon's attacks. That Pokémon can't use that attack during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Pick and Choose
attacks.text: Choose either Burned or Poisoned, and either Asleep or Confused. The Defending Pokémon is now affected by both Special Conditions.

attacks.name: Reactive Poison
attacks.text: Does 50 damage plus 20 more damage for each Special Condition affecting the Defending Pokémon.

abilities.name: Crush Chance
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when you put Tauros from your hand onto your Bench, you may discard a Stadium card in play.

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Pokémon and put them onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

abilities.name: Fluffy Fur
abilities.text: If Wigglytuff is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if Wigglytuff is Knocked Out), the Attacking Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw 3 cards.

attacks.name: Pester
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is affected by a Special Condition, this attack does 30 damage plus 20 more damage.

abilities.name: Water Pressure
abilities.text: As long as Blastoise's remaining HP is 40 or less, Blastoise does 40 more damage to the Defending Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Hydro Pump
attacks.text: Does 50 damage plus 20 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Blastoise but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. You can't add more than 40 damage in this way.

abilities.name: Spike Storm
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Cacturne is your Active Pokémon, you may put 1 damage counter on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon that already has any damage counters on it. This power can't be used if Cacturne is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Triple Needle
attacks.text: Choose 3 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage to each of those Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Focus Energy
attacks.text: During your next turn, Combusken's High Jump Kick attack's base damage is 70.

abilities.name: Cursed Glare
abilities.text: As long as Dusclops is your Active Pokémon, your opponent can't attach any Special Energy cards (except for Darkness and Metal Energy cards) from his or her hand to his or her Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Psychic Shield
attacks.text: Prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Dusclops by your opponent's Pokémon-ex during your opponent's next turn.

abilities.name: Delta Sign
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for a Pokémon that has δ on its card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward. You can't use more than 1 Delta Sign Poké-Power each turn. This power can't be used if Fearow is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Agility
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of an attack, including damage, done to Grovyle during your opponent's next turn.

abilities.name: Thick Fat
abilities.text: Any damage done to Grumpig by attacks from Fire Pokémon and Water Pokémon is reduced by 30 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Circular Steps
attacks.text: Does 10 damage times the number of Pokémon in play (both yours and your opponent's), excluding Grumpig.

abilities.name: Hover Lift
abilities.text: You pay Colorless less to retreat your Jigglypuff, Wigglytuff, Wigglytuff ex, and Igglybuff.

abilities.name: Baby Evolution
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put Jigglypuff from your hand onto Igglybuff (this counts as evolving Igglybuff) and remove all damage counters from Igglybuff.

cards.name: Kingler δ
cards.text: This Pokémon is both Fire Metal type.

attacks.name: Body Slam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Prop-up Pinchers
attacks.text: If Kingler has a Pokémon Tool card attached to it, this attack does 40 damage plus 40 more damage.

attacks.name: Surprise
attacks.text: Choose 1 card from your opponent's hand without looking. Look at the card you chose, then have your opponent shuffle that card into his or her deck.

attacks.name: Bass Control
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 40 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Mud Splash
attacks.text: Does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

abilities.name: Dual Armor
abilities.text: As long as Medicham has any Psychic Energy cards attached to it, Medicham is both Psychic and Fighting type.

attacks.name: Psyshock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Sky Uppercut
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

abilities.name: Delta Transport
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Pelipper is on your Bench, you may switch 1 of your Active Pokémon that has δ on its card with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Supersonic
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

abilities.name: Echo Draw
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may draw a card. This power can't be used if Swampert is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Rock Hurl
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

abilities.name: Chlorophyll
abilities.text: All Energy cards that provide only Colorless Energy attached to your Grass Pokémon provide Grass Energy instead.

attacks.name: Green Blast
attacks.text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each Grass Energy attached to all of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Toxic Sleep
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep and Poisoned. Put 2 damage counters instead of 1 on the Defending Pokémon between turns.

attacks.name: Rage
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on Charmeleon.

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard a Fire Energy attached to Charmeleon.

attacks.name: Thunder Jolt
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, Charmeleon does 10 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Searing Flame
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Firebreathing
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 20 more damage.

attacks.name: Detect
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of an attack, including damage, done to Grovyle during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Amnesia
attacks.text: Choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon's attacks. That Pokémon can't use that attack during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Sleep Powder
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Stretch Vine
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Sharp Leaf
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 40 damage plus 20 more damage.

attacks.name: Roar
attacks.text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon, if any.

attacks.name: Metal Charge
attacks.text: Put 1 damage counter on Lairon.

attacks.name: Plunder
attacks.text: Before doing damage, discard all Trainer cards attached to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Hug
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Self Charge
attacks.text: Attach a Darkness Energy card from your hand to Nuzleaf.

attacks.name: Ascension
attacks.text: Search your deck for a card that evolves from Shuppet and put it onto Shuppet. (This counts as evolving Shuppet.) Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Feint Attack
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 20 damage to that Pokémon. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies, or any other effects on that Pokémon.

attacks.name: Bubble
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Tail Whip
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon can't attack during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Flail
attacks.text: Does 10 damage times the number of damage counters on Aron.

attacks.name: Poisonpowder
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Growth
attacks.text: Attach a Grass Energy card from your hand to Bulbasaur.

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Rising Lunge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage.

attacks.name: Retaliate
attacks.text: Does 10 damage times the number of damage counters on Charmander.

attacks.name: Sand Pit
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw a card.

attacks.name: Sniff Out
attacks.text: Put any 1 card from your discard pile into your hand.

attacks.name: Quick Blow
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage.

attacks.name: Hypnoblast
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Vital Pinchers
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage.

abilities.name: Aqua Lift
abilities.text: If Lotad has any Water Energy attached to it, the Retreat Cost for Lotad is 0.

attacks.name: Pure Power
attacks.text: Put 2 damage counters on your opponent's Pokémon in any way you like.

abilities.name: Submerge
abilities.text: As long as Mudkip is on your Bench, prevent all damage done to Mudkip by attacks (both yours and your opponent's).

attacks.name: Nap
attacks.text: Remove 2 damage counters from Mudkip.

attacks.name: Take Down
attacks.text: Numel does 10 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Spearhead
attacks.text: Draw a card.

attacks.name: Psywave
attacks.text: Does 10 damage times the amount of Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

abilities.name: Solid Shell
abilities.text: Any damage done to Squirtle by attacks is reduced by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Bubblebeam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Claw
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Sand Attack
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Paralyzing Gaze
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Shining Claws
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Supersonic
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

cards.name: Bill's Maintenance
cards.text: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.,If you have any cards in your hand, shuffle 1 of them into your deck, then draw 3 cards.

cards.name: Castaway
cards.text: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.,Search your deck for a Supporter card, a Pokémon Tool card, and a basic Energy card. Show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

cards.name: Celio's Network
cards.text: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.,Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon or Evolution card (excluding Pokémon-ex), show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

cards.name: Cessation Crystal
cards.text: Attach Cessation Crystal to 1 of your Pokémon (excluding Pokémon-ex) that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it. If the Pokémon Cessation Crystal is attached to is a Pokémon-ex, discard this card.,As long as Cessation Crystal is attached to an Active Pokémon, each player's Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's) can't use any Poké-Powers or Poké-Bodies.

cards.name: Crystal Beach
cards.text: This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.,Each Special Energy card that provides 2 or more Energy (both yours and your opponent's) now provides only 1 Colorless Energy. This isn't affected by any Poké-Powers or Poké-Bodies.

cards.name: Crystal Shard
cards.text: Attach Crystal Shard to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it. If that Pokémon is Knocked Out, discard this card.,As long as Crystal Shard is attached to a Pokémon, that Pokémon's type is Colorless. If that Pokémon attacks, discard this card at the end of the turn.

cards.name: Double Full Heal
cards.text: Remove all Special Conditions from each of your Active Pokémon.

cards.name: Dual Ball
cards.text: Flip 2 coins. For each heads, search your deck for a Basic Pokémon card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

cards.name: Holon Circle
cards.text: This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.,Prevent all effects of an attack, including damage, done by either player's Active Pokémon. If an Active Pokémon uses an attack, that attack ends, and discard this card.

cards.name: Memory Berry
cards.text: Attach Memory Berry to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it. If that Pokémon is Knocked Out, discard this card.,The Pokémon this card is attached to can use any attack from its Basic Pokémon or its Stage 1 Evolution card. (You still have to pay for that attack's Energy cost.) If that Pokémon attacks, discard this card at the end of the turn.

cards.name: Mysterious Shard
cards.text: Attach Mysterious Shard to 1 of your Pokémon (excluding Pokémon-ex) that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it. If the Pokémon Mysterious Shard is attached to is a Pokémon-ex, discard this card.,Prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to the Pokémon that Mysterious Shard is attached to by your opponent's Pokémon-ex. Discard this card at the end of your opponent's next turn.

cards.name: Poké Ball
cards.text: Flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for a Basic Pokémon or Evolution card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

cards.name: PokéNav
cards.text: Look at the top 3 cards of your deck, and choose a Basic Pokémon, Evolution card, or Energy card. Show it to your opponent and put it into your hand. Put the 2 other cards back on top of your deck in any order.

cards.name: Warp Point
cards.text: Your opponent switches 1 of his or her Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon, if any. You switch 1 of your Active Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon, if any.

cards.name: Windstorm
cards.text: Choose up to 2 in any combination of Pokémon Tool cards and Stadium cards in play (both yours and your opponent's) and discard them.

cards.name: Energy Search
cards.text: Search your deck for a basic Energy card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

cards.name: Potion
cards.text: Remove 2 damage counters from 1 of your Pokémon (remove 1 damage counter if that Pokémon has only 1).

cards.name: Double Rainbow Energy
cards.text: Double Rainbow Energy can be attached only to an Evolved Pokémon (excluding Pokémon-ex). While in play, Double Rainbow Energy provides every type of Energy but provides 2 Energy at a time. (Has no effect other than providing Energy.) Damage done to your opponent's Pokémon by the Pokémon Double Rainbow Energy is attached to is reduced by 10 (before applying Weakness and Resistance). When the Pokémon Double Rainbow Energy is attached to is no longer an Evolved Pokémon, discard Double Rainbow Energy.

cards.name: Aggron ex

abilities.name: Intimidating Armor
abilities.text: As long as Aggron ex is your Active Pokémon, your opponent's Basic Pokémon can't attack or use any Poké-Powers or Poké-Bodies.

cards.text: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Split Bomb
attacks.text: Choose 2 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack doe 30 damage to each of them. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Mega Burn
attacks.text: During your next turn, Aggron ex can't use Mega Burn.

cards.name: Blaziken ex
cards.text: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Drag Off
attacks.text: Before doing damage, you may choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon and switch it with 1 of the Defending Pokémon. Your opponent chooses the Defending Pokémon to switch.

attacks.name: Burn Away
attacks.text: Before doing damage, count the remaining HP of the Defending Pokémon. If that Pokémon is Knocked Out by this attack, Blaziken ex does damage to itself equal to the attack's damage minus the remaining HP of the Defending Pokémon. This attack's damage isn't by Weakness, Resistance, Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies, or any other effects on that Pokémon.

cards.name: Delcatty ex

abilities.name: Constrain
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may use this power. Each player discards cards until that player has 6 cards in his or her hand. (You discard first.) This power can't be used if Delcatty ex is affected by a Special Condition.

cards.text: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Upstream
attacks.text: Search your discard pile for all Energy cards. This attack does 10 damage times the number of Energy cards you find there. Show them to your opponent, and put them on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward.

cards.name: Exploud ex

abilities.name: Extra Noise
abilities.text: As long as Exploud ex is your Active Pokémon, put 1 damage counter on each of your opponent's Pokémon-ex between turns.

cards.text: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Derail
attacks.text: Discard a Special Energy card, if any, attached to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Hyper Tail
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon has any Poké-Powers or Poké-Bodies, this attack does 60 damage plus 20 more damage.

cards.name: Groudon ex

abilities.name: Hard Rock
abilities.text: As long as Groudon ex has 1 Energy or less attached to it, damage done to any of your Groudon ex in play by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance). You can't use more than 1 Hard Rock Poké-Body each turn.

cards.text: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Power Blast
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy attached to Groudon ex.

cards.name: Jirachi ex

abilities.name: Star Light
abilities.text: As long as your opponent has any Pokémon-ex or Stage 2 Evolved Pokémon in play, Jirachi ex pays Colorless less Energy to use Shield Beam or Super Psy Bolt.

cards.text: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Shield Beam
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, your opponent can't use any Poké-Powers on his or her Pokémon.

cards.name: Kyogre ex

abilities.name: Flotation
abilities.text: As long as Kyogre ex has 1 Energy or less attached to it, the Retreat Cost for each of your Kyogre ex is 0.

cards.text: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Hydro Shot
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy attached to Kyogre ex. Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 70 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Sceptile ex δ

abilities.name: Extra Liquid
abilities.text: Each player's Pokémon-ex can't use any Poké-Powers and pays Colorless more Energy to use its attacks. Each Pokémon can't be affected by more than 1 Extra Liquid Poké-Body.

cards.text: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Power Revenge
attacks.text: Does 60 damage plus 10 more damage for each Prize card your opponent has taken.

cards.name: Shiftry ex

abilities.name: Dark Eyes
abilities.text: After your opponent's Pokémon uses a Poké-Power, put 2 damage counters on that Pokémon.

cards.text: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Target Attack
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage to that Pokémon. If that Pokémon already has any damage counters on it, this attack does 50 damage instead. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Swampert ex

abilities.name: Energy Recycle
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your discard pile for 3 Energy cards and attach them to your Pokémon in any way you like. If you do, your turn ends. This power can't be used if Swampert ex is affected by a Special Condition.

cards.text: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Ultra Pump
attacks.text: You may discard 2 cards from your hand. If you do, this attack does 60 damage plus 20 more damage and does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Alakazam ★
cards.text: You can't have more than 1 Pokémon Star in your deck.

attacks.name: Psychic Select
attacks.text: Put any 1 card from your discard pile into your hand.

attacks.name: Skill Copy
attacks.text: Discard a Basic Pokémon or Evolution card from your hand. Choose 1 of that card's attacks. Skill Copy copies this attack. This attack does nothing if Alakazam Star doesn't have the Energy necessary to use that attack. (You must still do anything else required for that attack.) Alakazam Star performs that attack.

cards.name: Celebi ★

abilities.name: Time Travel
abilities.text: If Celebi Star would be Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack, you may flip a coin. If heads, Celebi Star is not Knocked Out, discard all cards attached to Celebi Star, and put Celebi Star on the bottom of your deck.

cards.text: You can't have more than 1 Pokémon Star in your deck.

attacks.name: Leaf Shade
attacks.text: Count the amount of Energy attached to Celebi Star. Put that many damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.
